p: In A. ostoyae we found 987 and 35 significantly upregulated genes (log 2FC > 1, p-value < 0.05) in invasive vs. non-invasive mycelium (M vsNIM) and in invasive vs. non-invasive rhizomorphs (R vsNIR) (5.74% and 0.2% of transcriptome), respectively. Considerably more, 2108 and 327 upregulated genes were found to be differentially expressed in M vsNIM and R vsNIR in A. cepistipes, respectively (13.29% and 2.06% of transcriptome; Supplementary Table S2). The number of differentially abundant proteins (DAPs) in the proteomics analysis was lower: we detected 279 and 108 proteins with increased abundance in MvsNIM and RvsNIR in A. ostoyae (8.78 and 3.40 % of detected proteome), and 439 and 282 proteins with increased abundance in MvsNIM and RvsNIR, respectively, in A. cepistipes (13.58 and 8.73 % of detected proteome; Supplementary Table S3).
